title: Man dies waiting for appointment order as teacher: Panneerselvam demands government job for bereaved wife
content: ADMK Workers Rights Retrieval Committee leader O. Panneerselvam criticised the DMK government over the death of a man, who despite having been recruited as a teacher, had not received his appointment order. The man identified as A. Velmurugan of Oddanchatram taluk in Dindigul district.

title: Mann Ki Baat: Women achievers to take over PM Modi's social media accounts to mark Women's Day
content: PM Narendra Modi will hand over his social media accounts to women achievers in different fields to mark the International Women’s Day on March 8. With followers in tens of millions on X, YouTube and Instagram, PM Modi is one of the most followed global leaders on social media.

title: Tension in Chooralmala in Kerala’s Wayanad after police block landslide survivors from staging protest
content: Protesters were planning to construct makeshift huts on the landslide-affected area around 9 a.m. However, their march was blocked by the police near the makeshift Bailey Bridge. This led to altercations between the police and the people who demanded that the rehabilitation process be fast-tracked.

title: NDRF 10th Batallion deploys teams to rescue persons trapped in SLBC tunnel in Telangana
content: N.R.F. 10th Battalion has sent four teams to rescue people trapped in a tunnel in Telangana. The tunnel is located at Kondapur village in Krishna district. The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) is coordinating the rescue operation.

title: Atishi chosen as Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly
content: AAP supremo Arvind Kejriwal was also part of the meeting of the party's 22 MLAs. Former Delhi chief minister and MLA Atishi was chosen as the Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly at a meeting of AAP MLAs in New Delhi on Sunday.

title: Shashi Tharoor stirs fresh controversy by underlining ‘absence of a leader in Kerala’s Congress’
content: Congress Working Committee (CWC) member Shashi Tharoor, MP, appeared to have ruffled his party's feathers by purportedly underscoring the “absence of a leader in Kerala’s Congress” in a newspaper interview published from New Delhi on Sunday (February 23, 2025) He also seemed to cast a pall of despondency over the State Congress’ leadership aspirations of wresting power.

title: MLC election in Andhra Pradesh: Officials making fool-proof arrangements
content: North Andhra Teachers MLC election scheduled to be held on February 27, 2025. Administrations of Vizianagaram, Srikakulam and Parvatipuram-Manyam districts are making fool-proof arrangements. The total number of voters is 22,493 in all the six districts.

title: T.N. CM Stalin calls for total withdrawal of Advocates Amendment Bill
content: DMK president and Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin on Sunday (February 23, 2025) demanded the total withdrawal of Advocates Amendment Bill 2025. The Union Law Ministry had on February 22 put the draft Bill on hold and announced that it would bring in a new draft Bill to amend the Advocates Act.

title: Four T.N. Ministers to hold talks with government employees’ associations
content: The Tamil Nadu government on Sunday (February 23, 2025) announced that a team of four Ministers would hold talks in the Secretariat on February 24, Monday. Their demands include restoring of the Old Pension Scheme and resumption of various incentives that were withdrawn by the State government.

title: AIDSO stages protest over delay in release of scholarships for students
content: Members of the All India Democratic Students’ Organisation (AIDSO) staged a demonstration in the city on Saturday condemning the delay in the release of scholarships for students. The AIDSO said a significant number of students rely on government aid and scholarships to pursue higher education.

title: Sambhal administration set to install 300 CCTV cameras at 127 locations across city
content: The administration in Sambhal is set to install 300 CCTV cameras at 127 locations across the city. This comes following violence in November last year in which four persons were killed. The project, funded under the 15th Finance Commission grant, will be implemented as part of the city surveillance initiative.

title: News in Frames: Silent coops, hidden threat
content: Badampudi, a small village in Eluru district about 100 kilometres from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, has been facing tough times. The narrow lanes of the village, usually bustling with farmers tending to their poultry, now stand eerily silent. A red flag flutters at the village’s entrance, marking it as a newly declared biosecurity zones.

title: Aided schools directed to compensate for making 12 teachers work for ₹500 per month
content: The High Court of Karnataka has directed the management of aided-schools to pay them as compensation the wages, on par with the minimum pay scale paid to regular teachers. The petitioners had served for a period ranging from two years to 13 years in various schools run by the trust in Mysuru.

title: Assam cabinet nod for ₹1.22 lakh crore investment proposals ahead of business summit
content: Assam cabinet on Sunday approved investment proposals worth ₹1.22 lakh crore ahead of the second edition of the state business summit. The two-day Advantage Assam 2.0 Investment and Infrastructure Summit will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on February 25, 2025.

title: Barefoot no more: Club Hasiru Sole, an upcycling movement led by two school students of Bengaluru
content: Vedika Balachandar and Ameya Uchil from a private school in Bengaluru have formed Club Hasiru Sole. They collect old footwear from the houses in their neighborhood, restore them and distribute them to the children in orphanages, slum communities, pourakarmikas, sanitation workers.

title: Knife attack in France leaves one dead, Macron labels it 'Islamist terror act'
content: A knife attack in Mulhouse, eastern France, on Saturday resulted in one civilian's death and serious injuries to two police officers. President Emmanuel Macron described the incident as an 'Islamist terror act' The 37-year-old suspect, on a terror prevention watchlist, was arrested.

title: Warning: 'Beware of magical Virat's big-match mindset'
content: Former Pakistan batter Ahmed Shehzad warns Pakistan's bowlers about an impending top performance from Virat Kohli. Kohli recently showed signs of returning to form with a 52-run knock against England. However, shehzad emphasizes the importance of India's top-order batting long to avoid exposing their all-rounders.

title: Uttarakhand man hires assassin to murder ‘son’s killer’ out on bail
content: Police have apprehended the victim's father and two assailants, while two suspects remain at large. The case dates back to June 28 last year when 27-year-old Kapil Saini was found dead in an orchard with bullet wounds. During the investigation, police found that Kapil was last seen with his close friend Ankit Chaudhary, 26, who allegedly killed Kapil.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look at Wesley to replace Alexander-Arnold
content: Liverpool want to sign Micky van de Ven as a partner for Virgil van Dijk. The Reds could move for Flamengo's Wesley to replace Trent Alexander-Arnold. The 21-year-old Brazilian has reportedly been watched by Liverpool scouts for around a year.

title: Ange rubbishes 'hysteria,' points to Spurs 'reset'
content: Tottenham Hotspur beat Ipswich Town 4-1 in the Premier League on Saturday. Spurs had been in a downward spiral over the festive period, dropping as low as 15th in the table. Ange Postecoglou dismisses the notion that Spurs could have been relegated.

title: Pulisic misses penalty as AC Milan lose at Torino
content: AC Milan held 2-1 by Torino in Serie A. Malick Thiaw and Christian Pulisic miss penalty for Milan. Milan in seventh place, six points behind leaders Napoli. Torino are 11th with 31 points.

title: Inside Canada's epic win: Grades, takeaways, early questions for 2026 Olympics
content: The U.S. and Canada meet in the final of the 4 Nations hockey tournament. The game was decided in overtime by a goal by Connor McDavid. The winner will go on to play in the Winter Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Has international hockey replaced the NHL All-Star Game for good?
content: "Nothing's done more for hockey in a decade than what this tournament's done," Team Canada coach Jon Cooper said. The audience was massive -- with 9.3 million viewers, it was the most-watched non-Olympic hockey game ever in the United States. People who don't usually talk about hockey were suddenly talking about hockey.

title: Connor Hellebuyck, Alex Ovechkin and the biggest NHL betting storylines
content: Winnipeg Jets goaltender Connor Hellebuyck is having one of the best seasons in recent memory. He has a 2.06 GAA and 34 wins to propel his team to the best record in the league. A goalie has won the Hart Trophy only seven times since 1924 and only once since 200.

title: 'Ripped away': Inside the Mavericks' struggle to manage the post-Luka trade backlash
content: Luka Doncic was traded to the Los Angeles Lakers in the dead of night. Jake Reedy was drinking with friends at Local Public Eatery in Dallas. He ordered Sharpies, duct tape and poster board on Postmates, Ubered home and came up with a plan.

title: 'He thought of everything': How Mookie Betts' offseason could cement him at shortstop
content: Mookie Betts spent five months learning shortstop in the midst of a major league season. The Los Angeles Dodgers' first-base coach helped Betts through the transition. "Oh, it ain't over yet," Betts said the day he gave it up. "For now it's over, but we're going to win the World Series"

title: Emery: 'Support' vital for 'fantastic' Rashford
content: Marcus Rashford came off the bench to inspire Aston Villa to a 2-1 win over Chelsea. Unai Emery said the on-loan forward's performance was "fantastic" Rashford joined Villa on loan from Manchester United until the end of the season.

title: PCB Blames ICC For 'India's National Anthem Row' In Lahore: "Hard To..."
content: India's national anthem played for a fraction of a second at the start of the Australia-England Champions Trophy match on Saturday. The Pakistan Cricket Board has blamed the ICC for the fiasco and demanded an explanation from the world body. India had refused to travel to Pakistan citing security concerns.

title: Elon Musk Recalls How He Fired Ex-X CEO Parag Agrawal After New DOGE Diktat
content: Elon Musk took a swipe at Parag Agrawal, former X chief executive officer. Musk has been roped in by US President Donald Trump to head the so-called Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) This came as Musk issued a diktat to federal employees to justify their work over the past week.

title: Vasundhara Oswal: The Billionaire's Daughter Who Was Detained In Uganda
content: Vasundhara Oswal is the daughter of business tycoons Pankaj and Radhika Oswal, who own the multibillion-dollar Oswal Group Global. She currently serves as the Executive Director (Finance) of PRO Industries, making history as the organisation's first female lead.

title: Arsenal title hopes in tatters after West Ham loss
content: Jarrod Bowen's goal gives West Ham United a surprise 1-0 away victory. Arsenal's last home league defeat came 10 months ago against Aston Villa. Mikel Arteta's side have 53 points from 26 games, eight behind leaders Liverpool. Manchester City face Liverpool away on Sunday.

title: Amorim criticizes United players for slow starts
content: Manchester United draw 2-2 with Everton at Goodison Park. Goals from Abdoulaye Doucouré and Bruno Fernandes put United ahead. Manuel Ugarte equalized for the visitors with a late penalty. United have now scored in the first half just once in their last 11 Premier League games.

title: Arteta blasts players' 'standards' in damaging loss
content: Arsenal lost 1-0 to West Ham at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday. Jarrod Bowen scored the only goal of the game in the 44th minute. Arsenal mustered just two shots on target in a subdued display. The result leaves Arsenal eight points adrift of Premier League leaders Liverpool.

title: Flick warns Barça must 'improve a lot' despite win
content: Barcelona beat Las Palmas 2-0 on Saturday to return to the top of LaLiga. Second-half goals from substitutes Dani Olmo and Ferran Torres secured victory. Real Madrid can move level on 54 points with Barça, one ahead of Atlético, on Sunday.

title: Shami Achieves Big Unwanted Record vs Pakistan, Surpasses Bumrah
content: Mohammed Shami bowled five wides in the opening over of the Champions Trophy. The Indian pacer was attended by team physio on the ground during his third over. Shami took 11 balls to complete his six-ball over. Tinashe Panyangara holds the record of bowling most wides (seven) in an over.

title: "Why Would They...": Gavaskar's Blunt Take As Pant, Others Remain On Bench
content: Team India went with an unchanged XI for their second Group A match against Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Sunday. The likes of Rishabh Pant, Varun Chakravarthy, Arshdeep Singh, and Washington Sundar were left on the bench.

title: No Empty Seat In Sight At Beirut Stadium For Hassan Nasrallah's Funeral
content: Hassan Nasrallah was killed when Israel's air force dropped more than 80 bombs on Hezbollah's main operations room on September 27. The ceremony was held at Lebanon's biggest sports arena - Camille Chamoun Sports City Stadium on the outskirts of Hezbollah-controlled southern suburbs.

title: "They Take Advantage Of US": Trump's Latest Jab Over USAID Funds For India
content: President Trump questioned why the US was providing aid to India, alleging that the country already benefits from high tariffs imposed on American goods. The "eighteen million" figure could not be independently verified as an earlier US government report through the Elon Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency claimed "$21 million" was allocated for "voter turnout" in India.

title: Kash Patel Asks FBI Employees To Ignore Elon Musk's "Justify-Your-Job" Mail
content: Elon Musk sent an email ultimatum to US federal workers on Sunday. FBI director Kash Patel has asked all FBI employees to "pause any responses" to Musk's email. "FBI personnel may have received an email from OPM requesting information," Patel said.

title: Muhammad Yunus Invites Musk To Bangladesh For Starlink Launch In "90 Days"
content: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus said integrating Starlink's connectivity into the country's infrastructure will have a transformational impact. Yunus told the SpaceX and Tesla CEO that his visit to Bangladesh would allow him to meet young Bangladeshi men and women.

title: "Mud They Throw At Us...": Giorgia Meloni's Shoutout For PM Modi, Trump
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) in Washington DC. She accused the Left of hypocrisy and of reacting with "hysteria" to the rise of conservative leaders globally. PM Meloni praised US President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance while attacking what she referred to as "elites"

title: 🥍 NCAA women's lacrosse
content:
0:40

Michigan scores at the horn to reach first women's lacrosse quarterfinal

0:40

Izzy Scane's late goal helps No. 3 Northwestern top No. 1 Boston College

0:27

Michigan scores at the horn to reach first women's lacrosse quarterfinal

Jill Smith scores for Michigan right before time expires to stun Notre Dame and send the Wolverines to their first-ever women's lacrosse quarterfinals.

title: 🏐 NCAA men's volleyball scoreboard
content: Content extraction failed.

title: Are you not entertained? Man United go from ridiculous to sublime
content: Manchester United held to a 2-2 draw by Everton at Goodison Park. United were 2-0 down before Bruno Fernandes' superb free kick sparked a comeback. Manuel Ugarte struck an equalizer with only their second shot on goal.

title: Who could steal Virginia Tech's at-large bid?
content: ESPN's Bracketology efforts are focused on projecting the NCAA tournament field just as we expect the NCAA Division I basketball committee to select the field in March. ESPN bracketologist Charlie Creme uses the same data points favored by the committee, including strength of schedule and other season-long indicators.

title: After losing to West Ham, is Arsenal's title race now over?
content: West Ham United beat Arsenal 1-0 in their Premier League clash on Saturday. Hammers striker Evan Ferguson was replaced in the second half by Cesc Fabregas. Gunners boss Arsene Wenger said he was "really annoyed" with his team's performance.

title: Delhi Man Takes Wife To Maha Kumbh, Slits Her Throat At Hotel To Hide Affair
content: A couple from Delhi's Trilokpuri arrived in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj to witness the Mahakumbh festival. They checked into a modest homestay to spend the night but by morning, the wife's blood-soaked body lay sprawled across the room. Police took 48 hours to crack the case and arrest the husband.

title: Video: Inside Telangana Tunnel Where Roof Collapsed, 8 Workers Trapped
content: The roof of the tunnel in Telangana's Nagarkurnool district collapsed over 30 hours ago. Teams from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), the army and the Singareni Collieries Co Ltd (SCCL) have been trying to rescue the trapped people.

title: ⚾ NCAA baseball scoreboard
content:
Around the Diamond: SEC collects a slew of ranked wins

No. 1 Texas takes down No. 11 Arizona and No. 6 Texas A&M handles No. 8 Florida State for softball, while Alabama takes down No. 12 NC State and OU defeats No. 7 Oregon State in baseball.

title: Pakistan’s $240m Gwadar airport stands ready—But no flights, no passengers
content: Pakistan’s newest airport in Gwadar, fully funded by China at a cost of $240 million, remains unused months after its completion in October 2024. Despite being the largest in Pakistan and part of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), the airport has no scheduled flights.

title: CT: Jasprit Bumrah to cheer from the stands as India take on Pakistan
content: Jasprit Bumrah will miss India's crucial Champions Trophy match against Pakistan due to a back injury. His replacement, Harshit Rana, joins the team as India aims for a semi-final berth. Pakistan faces must-win pressure after a defeat to New Zealand.

title: CAG report in Delhi assembly: BJP MLA says 'many things will come to light'
content: BJP will present the CAG report in the Delhi assembly on February 25. The report is expected to shed light on various issues including irregularities in excise policy, renovation of former CM's residence, and education policies. Delhi assembly's first session will begin on February 24, where MLAs will take their oath and elect a new Speaker.

title: IND vs PAK: Virat Kohli and Babar Azam share a heartwarming moment
content: Virat Kohli and Babar Azam shared a touching moment ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Pakistan opted to bat first with Imam-ul-Haq replacing Fakhar Zaman. Team India aims to secure their semi-final spot, while Pakistan face immense pressure after their recent heavy defeat.

title: 'Mann ki Baat': PM to let selected women take over his X, Instagram on Women's Day
content: PM Modi celebrated India's space achievements during his 'Mann Ki Baat' address. He also announced that inspiring women will take over his social media accounts on National Women's Day. PM Modi encouraged celebrating National Science Day by visiting research labs.

title: Chhaava box office collection day 9: Vicky Kaushal’s drama closes in on Rs 400cr
content: Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna’s historical drama ‘Chaava’ is keeping Bollywood abuz with its box office success. The film has nearly collected Rs. 393.35 crore worldwide in just 9 days.

title: 'Bye, Bye': Pandya's fiery send-off to Babar Azam - Watch
content: Hardik Pandya dismissed Babar Azam during ICC Champions Trophy 2025 match. Pandya's intense send-off sparked celebrations and controversy. Babar, who had started positively, fell in the ninth over. This set the tone for India and added to the intense rivalry between the two teams.

title: ‘Punjab is important, not ...': AAP minister responds to 'non-existent' dept row
content: Punjab minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal responded to the abolition of the 'non-existent' department of administrative reforms by the Punjab government. He said the department's existence is secondary to Punjab's welfare, which remains the government's primary focus.

title: Telangana tunnel collapse: Ventilation system keeps trapped workers alive
content: A portion of the tunnel roof at Srisailam Left Bank Canal in Nagarkurnool district collapsed, trapping eight workers inside. While 52 workers escaped, the search and rescue efforts are ongoing with the involvement of NDRF, Army, and specialized tunnel rescue teams.

title: Former CM Atishi chosen leader of opposition in Delhi assembly
content: Aam Aadmi Party names Atishi as the leader of opposition in the Delhi assembly. She has become the first woman to hold this position in the assembly. Former Delhi CM and party head Arvind Kejriwal congratulated Atishi on X: "I congratulate Atishi ji for being elected"

title: AI startup CEO says funding is like dating: VCs ignored us for ages, now ...
content: Sumanth Raghavendra, CEO of AI startup Presentations.ai, humorously compared securing funding to dating. His viral post on social media has sparked discussions on venture funding unpredictability. Presentation.ai recently raised $3 million in a seed round led by Accel, setting the stage for scaling their software.

title: 'Don’t want too much foreign influence on our decision-making': Jaishankar
content: External affairs minister Dr S Jaishankar emphasized India's strategic position in global affairs. He highlighted the need for balancing international relationships and maintaining national independence. He said that since India had been ruled by foreign power for so many years, it doesn't want to be ever tied to a foreign power.

title: Source: Rams let Stafford's agent gauge value
content: Rams have given Matthew Stafford's agent permission to speak to other teams. The sides have been discussing a reworked contract, a source told ESPN. Stafford has two seasons left on the extension, with $4 million guaranteed in 2025. Rams coach Sean McVay said after the season he hoped the team and Stafford would have clarity.

title: Embiid benched, declines comment as Sixers lose
content: Joel Embiid scored just 14 points in 31 minutes, missed all six 3-point attempts. He sat out the fourth quarter in the 105-103 loss after a rough three quarters. The 76ers lost their seventh straight game, this one on a buzzer-beating tip-in.

title: Beterbiev-Bivol 2 takeaways: Trilogy fight should happen before Canelo, Benavidez
content: Dmitry Bivol defeats Artur Beterbiev to become undisputed light heavyweight champion. Joseph Parker beats late replacement Martin Bakole in two rounds in the heavyweight division. Shakur Stevenson scores just his second stoppage win in his past six fights.

title: Duke's Lucas focus of Miami search, sources say
content: Duke associate head coach Jai Lucas has emerged as the focus of Miami's search for a new basketball coach. Lucas, 36, is considered one of the country's top assistant coaches. Miami plays Duke on Tuesday in Coral Gables, Florida.

title: Bracketology: Kansas keeps sliding
content: The NCAA Division I basketball committee will select the field in March. ESPN bracketologist Joe Lunardi uses the same data points favored by the committee. The primary adjustment from a normal year is, of course, the playing of the entire NCAA tournament at a single site. Visit the NCAA's website for a fuller understanding of NCAA selection criteria.

title: USMNT legend Meola recovering from heart attack
content: Former USMNT and MLS goalkeeper Tony Meola had a heart attack Thursday. Meola underwent an unspecified procedure after the heart attack. He made 101 appearances for the national team and had 35 shutouts. He was a four-time All-Star in 11 MLS seasons with the New York/New Jersey MetroStars.

title: Song decisions Cejudo after accidental eye poke
content: Song Yadong defeated Henry Cejudo by technical decision in Seattle. The fight was stopped after the third round because of an accidental eye poke. The 135-pound bout was scheduled for five rounds. After the result, Yadong suggested an immediate rematch.

title: Bettman to announce 1st-round picks for 1st time
content: The 2025 NHL draft will take place June 27-28 at L.A. Live's Peacock Theatre. Commissioner Gary Bettman will announce each first-round pick for the first time. The draft will be the first for hockey to use the decentralized model.

title: Founder complains about DocuSign's high cost; Zoho’s Sridhar Vembu replies
content: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu criticized DocuSign for overpricing. He suggested evaluating vendors' sales versus R&D expenses as a cost-saving measure. "DocuSign is a supremely bloated company th," he said.

title: IND vs PAK: Mohammed Shami's erratic start creates unwanted record
content: Mohammed Shami bowled an 11-ball opening over against Pakistan. Shami's wayward bowling included five wides, the most in an opening over, overshadowing Jasprit Bumrah's previous record. Hardik Pandya took India's first wicket, dismissing Babar Azam.

title: Pope's 'critical': What’s next for the Vatican and Catholic church?
content: Pope Francis remains in critical condition in hospital after suffering double pneumonia. His condition has raised questions about the future of the Vatican and the Catholic Church. The pope has been admitted to hospital since February 14 after suffering from bronchitis and blood transfusion problems.

title: Shashi Tharoor shares cryptic post amid rumors of rift with party
content: The Thiruvananthapuram MP shared a famous quote of English poet Thomas Gray on X. He had earlier asked Rahul Gandhi to specify the role he is to play in the party. Tharoor reportedly expressed his deep dissatisfaction over the way he was removed from the charges of All India Professional Congress.

title: Sunny Deol and MS Dhoni enjoy India vs Pakistan match together in Dubai
content: Cricket legend MS Dhoni and Bollywood star Sunny Deol watch the game together. Social media is abuzz with their appearance, enhancing the thrill of the epic cricket showdown. India vs Pakistan ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is all set to happen in Dubai.

title: Elon Musk on former Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal: 'fired...got nothing done…'
content: Elon Musk took a swipe at former X (previously known as Twitter) CEO Parag Agrawal, whom he fired in 2022 after acquiring the platform. Musk's Department of Government Efficiency ordered federal employees to justify their work weekly, sparking backlash and union opposition.

title: Sources: Popovich not expected back this season
content: Gregg Popovich is not expected to return to the San Antonio Spurs this season. The Hall of Fame coach is recovering from a stroke suffered in November. Spurs star Victor Wembanyama was diagnosed with a blood clot in his shoulder.

title: 'Locked in' Luka explodes as Lakers win in Denver
content: Luka Doncic scores 32 points in L.A.'s 123-100 win over the Denver Nuggets. It's the first time the Lakers have beaten the Nuggets in Denver since April 10, 2022. The Lakers ended the Nuggets' nine-game winning streak and also snapped an eight-game skid at Ball Arena.

title: After Mamata, Kharge's Kumbh remarks, PM Modi's 'slave mentality' retort
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized opposition leaders for their recent remarks on the Maha Kumbh. He emphasized the grandeur and unifying nature of the event, countering comments by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge. Modi said a section of leaders "mock and ridicule" the Hindu religion and try "weaken the country"

title: Billionaire’s daughter on Ugandan ordeal: ‘Male officer threw me in van'
content: Vasundhara Oswal was detained in a cell after providing a statement. She was asked to pay USD 30,000 and surrender her passport as part of a police bond. The 26-year-old was arrested on October 1, 2024, over the alleged abduction of Mukesh Menaria.

title: Odissi dancer Mayadhar Raut dies at 92
content: The Padma Shri awardee, born on July 6, 1933 in Odisha, is considered the "Father of Odissi dance" His training to become one of the foremost artistes of the dance form began at the age of seven. The last rites will be conducted at the Lodhi Road crematorium on Saturday.

title: DRDO indigenous submarine proposal to go for CCS approval in couple of months; eight years for first sub
content: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) is gearing up to bring a proposal to design and develop an indigenous conventional submarine to the Cabinet Committee on Security for approval. The indigenous submarine is expected to displace around 3,000 tonnes and will be capable of launching land attack cruise missiles (LACMs)

title: Factional feud returns to Birbhum in Bengal, ruling Trinamool Congress worker killed
content: Sheikh Niyamul. a Trinamool Congress was attacked on Friday night near Kankratala bus stop when he was returning home. He was admitted to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries. The attack, according to locals, was a result of a feud between two factions of the ruling party.

title: IIMB holds discussion on role of localised policymaking in global climate reparations
content: The Centre for Management Communication (CenComm), a Centre of Excellence at IIM Bangalore, organised a roundtable discussion on the role of sub-national policies in tackling climate change at the IIMB campus. The discussion sought to bridge the gap between global commitments and local execution.

title: BBMP mulls 5% property tax rebate for owners with e-khata
content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is contemplating a 5% rebate on property tax for owners securing the digital document. This may come into effect in the next financial year after receiving a green signal from the Deputy Chief Minister and Bengaluru Development Minister.

title: PM Modi on 3-day visit to M.P., Bihar, Assam from February 23
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be on a three-day visit to Madhya Pradesh, Bihar and Assam. He will attend the Global Investors Summit in Bhopal and the release of 19th instalment of cash assistance to farmers in Bhagalpur.

title: Going ahead with Group-II Mains examination as per schedule, asserts APPSC
content: The Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission (APPSC) has decided to go ahead and conduct the Group-II Mains written examination as per schedule on Sunday (February 23, 2025) The General Administration Department (GAD) wrote to the APPSC on Friday (February 21) night requesting it to reschedule the examinations.

title: Karnataka High Court expresses concern over ‘exploitation of human labour’ by State government
content: The High Court of Karnataka has ordered their regularisation from the date when they completed 10 years of service. Anandu, 58, has been working as a literate assistant for 39 years, and Ishwar, 54, a junior engineer working for 32 years.

title: Facing stiff resistance from legal fraternity, Law Ministry puts draft Bill to amend Advocates Act on hold
content: The Union Law Ministry on Saturday (February 22, 2025) announced that it would bring in a new draft Bill to amend the Advocates Act. The Bar Council of India (BCI) had written to Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal, stating that the proposed Bill seeks to undermine the ‘autonomy and independence of the Bar’

title: ‘Kerala brands to dominate country’s retail sector in near future’
content: Brands based in Kerala are likely to dominate the country’s retail sector in the near future.Active efforts are being made with the support of the State government to bring back the garment manufacturing industry to the State in a big way. Kalyan Silks chairman and managing director T.S. Pattabhiraman said the sector still had many opportunities to tap into.

title: Bus service between Maharashtra-Karnataka suspended in light of assault on State Transport employee
content: The MSRTC bus service between Maharashtra and Karnataka has been suspended from Kolhapur division by the Maharashtra government. The decision has been taken in light of the assault of a Maharashtra State Transport employee by some anti-social elements in Karnataka on Friday (February 21, 2025) night.

title: University of Madras holds election for one Syndicate post, 3 Senate spots
content:
S. Santhosh Baboo, principal of Dwaraka Doss Goverdhan Doss Vaishnav College, was elected to the Syndicate of the University of Madras in the election held on Saturday. He was elected to the post following the retirement of a university professor.

In the election for three senate posts held on Saturday, R. Krishnamoorthy, associate professor, Department of Zoology, Government Arts College, Nandanam; T. Mathuram, associate professor, Department of Zoology, Dr. Ambedkar Government Arts College, Vyasarpadi; and A.N. Swamynathan, associate professor, Department of Computer Science, Rajeswari Vedhachalam Government Arts College, Chengalpattu, were elected. All the elected persons are members of the Professors’ Forum.

title: FIR registered against Prathap Simha
content:
Udayagiri police registered an FIR against former MP and BJP leader Prathap Simha for his alleged remarks against the Muslim community.

He was booked under Section 196 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) which deals with promoting enmity between different groups on the grounds of religion, race, or language.

The FIR was registered after a complaint was lodged against the BJP leader’s remarks by the Mysuru city district youth congress committee.

title: Woman bike rider dies in accident at Kalamassery
content:
A woman riding a two-wheeler died in an accident near the Government Medical College Hospital, Kalamassery, on Saturday (February 22, 2025) noon, the second woman bike rider to die in an accident at Kalamassery within a week.

Bushara Beevi, 41, of Kakkanad reportedly lost control of the scooter that she was riding after she lost balance due to the gap between the tarred surface of the road and the shoulder that was resurfaced with concrete paver blocks. She was subsequently hit by a car. The unscientific construction of the road is said to have led to the accident. The police have launched a probe.

On Wednesday (February 19, 2025), a woman KSEB official was fatally hit by a lorry, hardly a few metres away from the spot where the police were engaged in vehicle inspection, near HMT Junction.

title: Education is the only key to end child labour, says child rights activist Shanta Sinha
content: The former Chairperson of the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) explained about the non-negotiable principle adopted by the M.V. Foundation that no child must work. She said poverty does not lead to child labour, but the social scourge of child labour leads to poverty.

title: 10 years on, pourakarmikas yet to receive flats at BDA’s Alur residential complex
content: The residential complex built by the Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) for the pourakarmikas at Alur has turned into ghost houses. The vacant portion of the premises has become a dumping yard for garbage. With no maintenance of the building cracks have surfaced on the walls, kitchens slabs have broken and some miscreants have also dumped waste inside the rooms.

title: Man held for stabbing father to death in broad daylight
content: A 25-year-old man was arrested for stabbing his father 15 times with a kitchen knife in broad daylight in Kushaiguda on Saturday. The incident was reported around 2 p.m. near ECIL bus terminal. His father, Arelli Mogli, 45, was rushed to a private hospital where he died.

title: Isolated parts of south coastal T.N., Puducherry likely to get light to moderate rains from Tuesday
content:
Isolated places in south coastal Tamil Nadu, Delta districts, Puducherry and Karaikal can expect light to moderate rain for four days from Tuesday, according to Regional Meteorological Centre in Chennai.

According to P. Senthamarai Kannan, director, area cyclone warning centre at the Regional Meteorological Centre Chennai, the rain is due to the movement of a cyclonic circulation over the equatorial regions. However, north Tamil Nadu has lesser chance of getting any rain from this circulation.

For Sunday and Monday, there is no change in maximum temperature over Tamil Nadu. Puducherry and Karaikal is expected, which is likely to be 2-3 degree Celsius, above normal. On the subsequent two days, a slight fall is expected.

For Chennai city, on Sunday the maximum temperature is expected to hover around 32-33 degree Celsius and minimum 23-24 degree Celsius. The sky condition would be partly cloudy with mist/haze likely to prevail during morning hours.

title: Annual rath yatra of Hare Krishna movement held
content:
The 14th annual rath yatra of Hare Krishna movement, Chennai, was celebrated on Saturday, with the idols of Sri Krishna and his consorts, Rukmini and Sathyabama; and Sri Gaura Nitai and Srila Prabhupada mounted on a beautifully decorated chariot, which was taken out through the streets of Besant Nagar, Adyar, and Thiruvanmiyur.

Speaking before the yatra commenced, former Director-General of Police K.P. Maghendran appreciated the youth and children outreach programmes of the movement. Spiritual speaker Dhamal Ramakrishnan and Chairman of the Akshya Patra Foundation and Chairman of the GBC body of the movement Madhu Pandit Prabhu graced the occasion.

The rath yatra witnessed traditional dance performances of Tamil Nadu, such as Kolattam, Karagattam, Puliattam, Kummiattam and Thappattam, by about four hundred artists.

title: Work for district sports complex in Tirupattur commences
content: After bifurcation from Vellore in 2019, Tirupattur is all set to get its own district sports complex. The new facility will encourage youngsters into diverse sports activities in the district to compete at the State and national level competitions.

title: Students of affiliated colleges can take up projects in Madras varsity
content: Students in colleges affiliated to the University of Madras will be allowed to pursue internship and projects in the university's departments. The students would be charged a nominal fee, which will be determined by the university’s syndicate, for using the facilities. Ph.D. scholars from affiliated colleges, who publish articles in peer-reviewed journals, must include the university and college in their articles.

title: Empty college bus catches fire near Katpadi
content: An empty private college bus was gutted near Thiruvalluvar University at Sekkadu village near Katpadi in Vellore on Saturday. Police said that an electrical short circuit might be the reason for the accident. A case has been registered by Tiruvalam police.

title: Vehicle modifiers warned of legal action
content: Hyderabad traffic police hosted an awareness programme for traders dealing in dark film, sirens, musical and multi-tone horns, modified silencers, number plates and other vehicle alterations. The session was attended by over 250 shop owners, automobile workshop operators, mechanics and registration number plate manufacturers.

title: Highways Department plants more than 2,000 saplings along city roads
content: The State Highways Department has speeded up the planting of saplings along city roads. Anna Salai, the Poonamallee High Road, Jawaharlal Nehru Salai and the Vanagaram-Ambattur-Puzhal Road have received around 2,000 saplings, each over six feet tall.

title: Rekha Gupta: From the wings to the centre
content: Rekha Gupta will oversee a new era of the BJP in the capital. The saffron party has been in the Opposition in Delhi for nearly 26 years. The first-time MLA was sworn in along with her council of Ministers the very next day.

title: ‘People often overlook divisions in the name of language and race’
content: Justice V. Ramasubramanian, Chairperson, National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) of India, spoke at a national forum for promoting communal amity. He said that the purpose of the Indian Constitution was to promote fraternity, and added that seven decades were “wasted on discussions about the relationship between state and religion”

title: Police seize 500 kg of beefwood in Vellore
content: Ariyur police seized 13 logs of beefwood, which weighs around 500 kgs, from a SUV during a routine vehicle check. Police said as part of surveillance against banned tobacco products and ganja, a police team led by Inspector S. Nagaraj noticed a SUV was parked on the extreme end of Ariyur Main Road.

title: T.N. to revisit TB diagnostic algorithm to focus on clinically vulnerable population
content: Last year, 93,301 TB cases were notified across Tamil Nadu. Of these, Chennai accounted for 14,750 cases. The State is planning to conduct extensive capacity-building exercises. It will offer upfront screening using chest X-ray.

title: Mayiladuthurai double murder case: a story with many versions
content: The trade has survived owing to lackadaisical police response and the significant difference between the prices of liquor in Tamil Nadu and the Union Territory. The State has again been forced to confront the consequences of failure to regulate bootlegging. Two 20-year-old youth were allegedly killed after villagers filed complaints against those involved in smuggling and selling of illicit liquor.

title: Call for special courts for women in cybercrime cases
content: Women investigative officers and special courts for women for POCSO cases and cybercrime courts are the need of the hour, says Sowmiya Anbumani. She called for protecting the identities and privacy of victims by the family, police, and judiciary. The IT Act protects only e-commerce and financial institutions from cybercrime attacks.

title: New rule allows Chhattisgarh shops to operate round the clock
content: The Chhattisgarh government has implemented the New Shops and Establishments Act that allows traders to keep their shops open seven days a week and 24 hours a day. A statement issued by the government on Saturday said the new policy was implemented to boost trade and create new employment opportunities.

title: Language politics to the fore in U.P. as BJP govt., Oppn. exchange barbs on promotion and neglect
content: The Congress leader injected language into his politics of social justice during the two-day visit on February 20-21. He accused the ruling BJP and its ideological mentor RSS of attempting to prevent marginalised people from learning English. Describing the language as the ‘biggest weapon’, he said it is a tool of mobility.

title: Army Chief embarks on 5-day trip to France
content:
Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi on Saturday (February 23, 2025) embarked on a five-day visit to France with an aim to explore ways to further boost bilateral military cooperation.

The visit aims at further strengthening mutual understanding, exchanging views on aspects of common interest and strengthening bilateral defence cooperation between the two nations, the Army said in a post on X.

The Army Chief is set to hold wide-ranging talks with his French counterpart.

title: Labour Minister assures swift action on EPS-95 pensioners' demands
content: Pensioners' body EPS-95 Agitation Committee said that Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has assured swift action on its demands. These demands include an increase in the minimum pension, provision of free medical facilities for pensioners and their spouses, and rectification of errors in applications for higher pension benefits.

title: Why is the three-language policy controversial? | Explained
content: The Union Government has withheld ₹2,152 crore in funds due to Tamil Nadu under the Samagra Shiksha scheme for refusing to join the Prime Minister Schools for Rising India (PMSHRI) initiative. While T.N. is eager to participate in the PM SHRI scheme, it staunchly opposes the accompanying mandate to implement the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.

title: How was Vikatan magazine website made inaccessible? | Explained
content: The website of the Tamil magazine, Vikatan, was rendered inaccessible for several readers on February 15. The BJP’s Tamil Nadu president K. Annamalai sent a letter to L. Murugan, the Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting. The magazine, as well as State leaders like Chief Minister M.K. Stalin, have condemned the move as an attack on freedom of expression.

title: Gyanesh Kumar: Chief of polls
content: Gyanesh Kumar took over as the 26th Chief Election Commissioner of India earlier this week. During his tenure in the Union Home Ministry, he headed the Jammu and Kashmir desk. He played a key role in policy implementation after the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019.

title: What is India’s dilemma over fighter jets? | Explained
content: The F-35 Joint Strike Fighter is a single seat, single-engine strike fighter jet with three variants. The programme has seven international partners, and 10 foreign military sales customers, and the jets are expected to be in service well into the 2080s.

title: USAID row: Information from U.S. 'concerning', government looking into it, says Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar said the information put out by the Trump administration people is "concerning" and that the government is looking into it. He also asserted that "our idea of security actually has to expand in a tech world"

title: Lab reports confirm bird flu at Deeplanagar in Andhra Pradesh’s NTR district
content: Deeplanagar in A. Konduru mandal has reported mass mortality of 3,000 broiler birds. The lab reports have confirmed the cause of their death as H5N1 virus that causes bird flu. District Collector G. Lakshmisha said there was no need for alarm.

title: Centre agrees to procure chilli under MIS if price drops below ₹11,781 per quintal, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu reviewed the plight of chilli farmers against the backdrop of a sharp fall in its price in the open market. Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan’s assurance to take steps that would salvage the situation.

title: Lanka Dinakar reiterates statement on misutilisation of MGNREGS funds
content: Twenty-Point Programme Chairperson Lanka Dinakar has alleged that the previous YSRCP government had failed to utilise the MNREGS funds and misused the funds. He said he had been reviewing the implementation of various Centrally-sponsored schemes district-wise between 2019 and 2024.

title: 30-point action plan for better healthcare services in Andhra Pradesh
content: 30-point action plan based on suggestions of Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu. These points comprise the health targets set for achieving Swarnandhra-2047. The Health Minister has instructed Special Chief Secretary M.T. Krishna Babu to review the performance of the department on these points.

title: A.P.’s first sea-based cruise tourism venture ‘Vizag Cruiser’ may start operations in two months
content: Cruise ship MV Sai Vaishnavi will ferry within 10 nautical miles in the Indian territorial waters off Visakhapatnam coast. The double-deck vessel has twin-engine, air-conditioned wardrooms suitable for parties, family functions, corporate events, business meetings and anniversaries.

title: Yasvantpur-Bhubaneswar Special to run 9 additional trips
content:
To manage the surge in passenger traffic, East Coast Railway has announced an extension of the weekly special train services between Bhubaneswar and Yasvantpur. There will be nine additional trips.

As per the announcement by the South Western Railway, 02811 Bhubaneswar-Yasvantpur Special will depart from Bhubaneswar at 7.15 p.m. on March 1, 8, 15, 22, and 29 and April 5, 12, 19, and 26. It will arrive at Yesvantpur station at 12.15 a.m. on the third day.

In the return direction, 02812 Yasvantpur-Bhubaneswar Express will depart from Yasvantpur at 4.30 a.m. on March 3, 10, 17, 24, and 31, and April 7, 14, 21, and 28. It will reach Bhubaneswar at 6 a.m. the following day.

title: BJP demands Telangana CM Revanth’s apology for stating that ‘A.P. is looting’ Krishna river water
content: BJP State vice-president S. Vishnuvardhan Reddy has found fault with the remarks of Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy that Andhra Pradesh is “looting the State’s share of water from the Krishna”

title: Army Mobilises Task Force for rescue operations at Srisailam tunnel collapse
content: Tunnel collapse near Srisailam Dam in Telangana, India. Indian Army mobilised Engineer Task Force (ETF) to assist in rescue. Rescue party of engineers and equipment specialists is on standby with heavy machinery, including a Size II BD80 Dozer, JCB, and SSL.

title: India remains cornerstone of UN peacekeeping, its women peacekeepers indispensable: UN peacekeeping chief
content: Women's Day is being held in India on February 14 and 15. The event is being organised by the International Women's Day Foundation (IWDF) to raise awareness of women's issues. IWDF is a non-profit organisation that promotes women's rights and equality.

title: Telangana: Rescue operation to save 8 persons trapped inside SLBC tunnel collapse on
content: The rescue operation to save eight persons trapped inside the Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) project tunnel following its roof collapse on Saturday morning is in progress. A joint rescue team formed with about 300 members comprising personnel from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), Army, National Highways & Infrastructure Development Corporation Ltd (NHIDCL) and the SDRF reached 11 km inside the tunnel.

title: Don’t mention caste names in temple invitation, orders Madras High Court
content: The Madras High Court has denounced the practice of mentioning the names of particular dominant castes in a temple festival invitation. The judges directed the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) department to ensure that the invitations to be printed in the  Hindu religion.

title: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren urges Telangana counterpart Revanth Reddy to ensure rescue of workers trapped in tunnel collapse; offers help
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren urged Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy to ensure all possible assistance for the rescue of workers. A section of a tunnel collapsed in the Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) project.

title: Death toll in Hathras accident rises to four
content:
The death toll in the motorcycle-rickshaw accident near Badar village here has risen to four, a police official said on Sunday (February 23, 2025).

Three teenage girls, including two sisters, died on Saturday (February 22, 2025) evening when their motorcycle lost control and rammed into a rickshaw here.

The accident occurred near Badar village in Saadabad police station area when Shahzad (24) was returning after taking his sisters -- Nargis (14) and Shahnaz (16) -- and their friend Pihu Sharma (17) from a school in Aligarh, officials said.

The four were returning to Agra when the motorcycle lost control on Agra Road, rammed into a rickshaw and fell, a police officer said.

Station House Officer (SHO), Sadabad, Satendra Singh Raghav, said while the three girls died on the spot, Shahzad was referred to a hospital in Agra where he succumbed to injuries.

title: Bihar govt to appoint 140 'protection officers' for women affected by domestic violence
content: The decision has been taken in view of the rising number of domestic violence cases in the state. The Social Welfare Department has decided to create a separate cadre under which sub-division, district and state-level protection officers will be appointed.

title: Two devotees on padayatra to Dharmasthala die in accident near Hassan
content:
Two pedestrians on a padayatra (foot march) to Dharmasthala were ran over by a private bus on National Highway 75, near Hassan early morning on Sunday (February 23, 2025).

Suresh, 60, and Kumar, 50, of K.R. Pet taluk in Mandya district were among hundreds of devotees on a padayatra to Dharmasthala in Dakshina Kannada distant to take part in Shivaratri on February 26. They died on the spot, while another person suffered injuries.

Shantigrama Police reached the place on receiving information about the accident. They shifted the injured to a hospital in Hassan.

Devotees from various parts of the State take out padayatra to Dharmasthala ahead of Shivarathri every year.

title: 32 Indian fishermen from Tamil Nadu arrested by Sri Lankan Navy
content: 32 fishermen from Rameswaram, Thangachimadam and nearby areas in Ramanathapuram district in Tamil Nadu were arrested by Sri Lankan Navy personnel on charges of poaching along the Palk Straits. Five trawlers were also seized.

title: Telangana tunnel collapse LIVE: Rescuers reached tunnel boring machine spot, says Nagarkurnool District Collector
content: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) 10th Battalion has deputed four teams to rescue the persons trapped in the Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) tunnel in Telangana. A part of the tunnel caved in on Saturday.

title: Complete desilting of 24 drains by May 31: NGT tells Delhi govt. department
content: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) was hearing the issue of desilting of the 24 drains, which fall in the Yamuna. Most of the work has been completed by February 14 in Moat Drain of Vijay Ghat (84.92%), followed by Civil-Military Drain (78.51%)

title: Trump again attacks USAID, claims $18 million given to India to help with elections
content: U.S. President Donald Trump claimed that the Biden administration allocated $18 million in funding to India to help with its elections. Mr. Trump made the remarks during a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) on Saturday (February 22, 2025)

title: KPSC scam: Sub-committee points to lapses committed by then Secretary in the recruitment of AEEs
content: The sub-committee has submitted a report to the government that 10 of those selected had indulged in exam malpractice. The sub- committee has asked the government to cancel the postings of 10 candidates, who got jobs after tampering with OMR (Optical Marks Recognition) sheets.

title: Watch: Delhi | Indian politics of the urbanscape
content: The BJP’s victory in tiny Delhi, which is not even a full state, was fueled by support from all quarters across the city. The election campaign was informed by rhetoric around communitarian identities. The election mandate also had important lessons to give on the issue of freebies or politics based on freebies with every party promising them. It showed that freebies once announced cannot be rolled back as they are seen as a right by beneficiaries but also that track record in delivering freebies is also taken on board by the voters. Also, for the first time in Indian politics, politics of the city or an urban escape became a contributing factor.

title: Historian urges government to take steps to get Lepakshi temple included in UNESCO heritage list
content: Gorantla-based historian MyNaa Swamy urged Director Department of Cultural Affairs R. Mallikarjuna to appoint an expert committee and prepare a status report for the permanent recognition of the Lepakshi Veerabhadra temple complex in the UNESCO heritage list.

title: U.S. health regulator pulls up Jagsonpal Pharmaceuticals for manufacturing lapses at API plant
content: The U.S. health regulator has pulled up Jagsonpal Pharmaceuticals for significant manufacturing lapses at its Rajasthan-based active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) plant. In a warning letter issued to the company's Managing Director Manish Gupta, the USFDA noted that the correspondence summarizes significant deviations from Current Good Manufacturing Practice.

title: Periya Milaguparai UPHC in Tiruchi gets NQAS certification
content: The Urban Primary Health Centre (UPHC) at Periya Milaguparai in Tiruchi has received the National Quality Assurance Standards (NQAS) certification from the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The facility received certification for adhering to the highest standards in healthcare, especially in maternal and child care.

title: Srisailam witnesses heavy rush of devotees
content: Thousands of devotees visiting the Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy temple at Srisailam on the occasion of Mahasivaratri Brahmotsavams. Elderly people, children and women trek the dense forests for nearly 40km to reach the Shaivaite temple.

title: Six-member team to inquire alleged medico-negligence by Puttur doctor who left surgical mop inside woman’s body after C-section
content: A six-member team of officials and doctors will inquire into alleged negligence of a private doctor from Puttur. The woman’s husband, a farmer, said his wife delivered a baby on November 27, 2024, through C-section at a private hospital. After a week of discharge from the hospital, she had a fever for four days.

title: Political slugfest in U.P. as language debate takes centrestage
content: The language debate has gained traction over a political slugfest in Uttar Pradesh. Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi accused the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its ideological mentor, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) of attempting to prevent marginalised people from learning English.

title: Incessant seepage of water led to SLBC tunnel roof collapse
content: The Telangana government is making all efforts to save eight persons including two engineers and two other technical staff trapped 14 km inside the Srisailam Left Bank Canal. A portion of the tunnel collapsed due to incessant water seepage from the roof on Saturday morning.

title: Kochi metro’s Kakkanad extension: pre-casting of girders set to begin on March 1
content: Kochi Metro's 11.20 km extension is set to be completed by June 2026. The work has been delayed due to a dispute over the technical parameters of the project. More work is expected to begin within the next few days.

title: Governor’s appeal to surrender weapons in Manipur on a slow start
content: People of the Kuki-Zomi community in Churachandpur district surrendered 16 looted and illegal weapons. The weapons, including AK rifles, under-barrel grenade launchers and gelatine sticks, were surrendered with the joint efforts of Assam Rifles, State intelligence agencies.

title: Elderly woman burnt to death in Vadakara
content:
An elderly woman was burned to death after a fire engulfed her house at Villiappally near Vadakara in Kozhikode district on Saturday (February 22, 2025). The victim was identified as P.K. Narayani, 85, who reportedly lived alone in her old house.

The police said the incident took place around 7 p.m. Though some residents reportedly attempted to douse the flames after alerting the Fire and Rescue Services department and the police, they were unable to save her.

They added that a detailed inspection would be conducted on the spot with the support of forensic experts. The victim’s body was shifted to the district hospital in Vadakara. A post-mortem will be conducted on Sunday, February 23, 2025.

title: Tejashwi Yadav says he will welcome Nitish Kumar’s son Nishant Kumar’s entry into politics
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said he would welcome it if rumours were to be believed that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar’s son Nishant Kumar would enter politics. A section of ruling Janata Dal (United) leaders have been making statements that Mr. Nishant should join politics.

title: After requests from parents and students, Eklavya schools to go English medium from Class 9
content: The National Education Society for Tribal Students (NESTS) has issued a circular introducing English medium of instruction in all EMRS from Class 9. There won't be any change in themedium of instruction for Classes 10 and 12 in 2025-26. At present, there are 477 functional EMRSs across the country.

title: Reconsider redeployment of HSS teachers at fag end of academic year: KHSTU
content: The Kerala Higher Secondary Teachers’ Union (KHSTU) has written to the Minister for General Education demanding that the government reconsider redeployment of teachers. 420 government teacher posts were set to be abolished owing to the decline in number of students in higher secondary batches to below 25.

title: Applications invited for engineering, architecture courses
content:
The Commissioner for Entrance Examinations has invited online applications for admission to engineering, architecture, pharmacy and medical allied courses in the 2025 academic year.

The facility has opened for submitting applications on the web portal www.cee.kerala.gov.in. Candidates will be able to submit applications until 5 p.m. on March 10. Relevant documents including certificates of SSLC or equivalent, those proving nativity and date of birth, photograph and signature must be submitted online within the deadline.

Other documents including certificates meant to prove qualification and others will have to be uploaded on or before 5 p.m. on March 15. Further details can be obtained from the website or by contacting the helpline (0471-2332120, 0471-2338487, 0471-2525300).

title: Surgical treatment for spinal deformities in children now covered under Ayushman Bharat scheme in Karnataka
content: The Karnataka Health Department has now included surgical treatment for spinal deformities such as scoliosis, kyphosis, and lordosis under the Ayushman Bharat-Arogya Karnataka health scheme. These deformities refer to abnormal curvatures of the spine.

title: Trinamool leaders O’Brien, Moitra meet Thangal
content: Trinamool Congress national leaders Derek O’Brien, MP, and Mahua Moitra visited Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) State President Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal at his house at Panakkad near here.

title: ₹150 crore fraud unearthed in Irinjalakuda
content:
A fraud amounting to ₹150 crore allegedly by a share trading firm has been unearthed in Irinjalakuda.

The police have registered cases against Bibin K. Babu, his wife, Jaitha Vijayan, brothers, Subin and Libin, on the complaints lodged by 32 investors.

Billion Bees, a share trading firm in Irinjalakuda, has duped the investors by offering high returns of ₹30,000 to ₹50,000 per month for an investment of ₹10 lakh.

The owners of the firm had promised to pay the returns whether the company is in profit or loss, said the complainants. They were paid regular returns for the initial five months. But when the investors failed to get the money for the last few months, they asked the firm to return their investment. But they were allegedly threatened by Bibin and his brothers.

It is suspected that the accused have escaped to Dubai. The police have launched an investigation.

title: Happy Trivandrum event at Manaveeyam Veedhi on Sunday
content:
The district administration, in association with the NGO Young Indians, will be organising ‘Happy Trivandrum’, an event filled with various fun activities, at Manaveeyam Veedhi on Sunday from 5.30 p.m. to 9.30 p.m.

District Collector Anu Kumari said in a video message that the project has been launched to wean away the public from digital screens and to encourage them to come out into public spaces.

Various events, including a band performance, gully cricket, other board games, face painting, caricature corner, penalty kick corner and food corner, are arranged as part of the Happy Trivandrum event, which has the tagline ‘Where our city comes alive.‘

title: Women are shattering boundaries in theatre, says Neelam Mansingh Chowdhry
content: Eight of the 15 plays that will be staged in the 15th edition of the International Theatre Festival of Kerala (ITFoK) 2025 are directed by women. Neelam Mansingh Chowdhry’s Hayavadana dives deep into themes of identity, selfhood, and the pursuit of perfection.

title: Human-wildlife conflict: ₹3.72 cr. for Kerala Forest dept to procure digital tools
content: The demand to modernise the Forest department to tackle the rising man-animal conflict has received a major push. A proposal submitted by the Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forest for setting up Emergency Operation Centres at the State and Division levels has been approved by the State government.

title: Railways withdraw controversial circular issued for loco pilots
content: Railways issued the extraordinary circular after the number of local pilots testing positive for alcohol ahead of duty went up. Blood tests at the chemical examiner’s laboratory revealed that alcohol content in almost all blood samples was nearly zero. Officials said the circular was issued as Railways could not afford to halt trains for about two hours until the staff was me.

title: Bitcoin India Wallet and Exchange owner held for duping man of ₹8.5 lakh
content: The accused, identified as S. Ramakrishna Reddy, 41, was traced to Anna Nagar, Chennai. He was operating a cryptocurrency exchange, Bitcoin India Software Services Pvt. Ltd. The case came to light when a 35-year-old resident of Jubilee Hills lodged a complaint.

title: Crash in chilli prices in A.P.: Chandrababu Naidu takes stock of situation with farmers, exporters
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu reviewed the plight of chilli farmers against the backdrop of a sharp fall in prices in the open market. Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan’s assurance to take steps to salvage the situation.

title: Nepal PM Oli hoping for invitation to visit India in first half of 2025: FM Arzu Rana
content: Nepal awaits invitation for its Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli to visit India. Comments indicate strain in ties between Delhi and Kathmandu over the Modi Government’s unusual delay in hosting the Nepali PM. Mr. Oli travelled to Beijing in November 2024, which is believed to have further broadened the divide.

title: New ration cards will be issued in Andhra Pradesh from March, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: The Government of Andhra Pradesh has initiated steps to issue new ration cards from March, says Nadendla Manohar, Civil Supplies Minister. He inaugurated several developmental works in Sangam mandal in Nellore district on Saturday.

title: Fight results: Bivol defeats Beterbiev, becomes undisputed champ
content: Dmitry Bivol defeated Artur Beterbiev by majority decision to become the undisputed light heavyweight championship at ANB Arena in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on Saturday night. The rematch was set 133 days after BeterBiev won a narrow majority decision.

title: 🥎 NCAA softball scoreboard
content:
Around the Diamond: SEC collects a slew of ranked wins

No. 1 Texas takes down No. 11 Arizona and No. 6 Texas A&M handles No. 8 Florida State for softball, while Alabama takes down No. 12 NC State and OU defeats No. 7 Oregon State in baseball.

title: 'What will you do after calling me?': Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons over Latent row
content: Rakhi Sawant has responded to the Maharashtra Cyber Cell summons regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comments on India's Got Latent. She has been called to provide her statement on February 27. Sawant expressed financial struggles and urged authorities to focus on more serious crimes.

title: 'Justify work or lose jobs': Musk's new rule for US federal staff
content: Elon Musk has issued a directive for federal employees to report their weekly productivity via email, following President Donald Trump's orders. Non-compliance will be considered as resignation. The move aims to enhance government efficiency, but has faced criticism from the American Federation of Government Employees.

title: 'They take advantage': Trump questions alleged USAID funding to India again
content: US President Trump criticized USAID's $18 million funding to aid India's elections. Trump also raised concerns about high tariffs on US goods and alleged misuse of funds in other countries. Trump suggested reverting to paper ballots and proposed seeking India's assistance with electoral processes.

title: 'Wrong anthem, 'missing' Indian flag ...': CT marred by off-field blunders
content: ICC Champions Trophy 2025 has been marred by off-field controversies. The Indian national anthem mix-up before the England-Australia match, the PCB's complaint about the missing 'Pakistan' watermark, and a flag controversy at Karachi's National Stadium have overshadowed the tournament.

title: Ind vs Pak: 'Haven't seen such a Pakistan team in years'
content: Harbhajan Singh and Shahid Afridi expressed disappointment over the current state of Pakistan cricket. Former India off-spinner said there is no comparison between the current Pakistan team and the ones that played till 2011-12. Both discussed this ahead of the India-Pakistan clash in the ICC Champions Trophy.

title: Warring Manipur groups start surrendering looted weapons
content: Several arms and ammunition have been voluntarily surrendered in Churachandpur and Kangpokpi districts. The surrendered weapons include rifles, grenade launchers, and a machine gun, aiming to create a safer atmosphere. Assam Rifles , CRPF and police launched a public awareness campaign.

title: Ind vs Pak: 'Agar Pakistan ne pehla punch maara, toh India...'
content: India and Pakistan will face each other in a Group A match of the Champions Trophy on Sunday. Former Pakistan batter Ahmed Shehzad previewed the match, highlighting India's current superiority but cautioning that Pakistan could be a threat. The match is crucial for Pakistan after their loss to New Zealand.

title: Angry over ex-girlfriend’s new relationship, man gang-rapes her with friends
content: Four men have been arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a woman in Bhiwandi. The woman was allegedly raped by four of her friends. The police are investigating the incident, which took place in the middle of the night. The victim has not been identified.

title: 'India ki batting ne Pakistan ko daraya hua hai'
content: India take on Pakistan in the Group A fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy. India's batting line-up and young spinners have dominated recent matches. Pakistan's depleting bowling reserves and inconsistent batters mean an upset is unlikely unless they perform exceptionally well.

title: 'If Gill gets out early ...': Ex-Pakistan cricketer ahead of India match
content: Ramiz Raja believes Pakistan's underdog status against India could be advantageous. He highlighted India's top-order vulnerabilities and Pakistan's need for sharper bowling strategies. Raja emphasised staying calm under pressure and the motivation of playing against a large Indian fanbase as key factors for Pakistan's potential victory.

title: Nitish Kumar's son Nishant can save JD(U) by joining politics: Tejashwi
content: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav supports Nishant Kumar entering politics. Suggests it could revitalize JD(U) and counter the influence of BJP allies. This follows Nishant's defense of his father's health and political leadership.

title: Babar's absence sparks speculation; PCB chief demands victory at any cost
content: Pakistan's star batter Babar Azam was conspicuously absent from the team's training session ahead of their high-stakes Champions Trophy clash against India. PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who attended the session, instructed the team to secure a win at any cost. Azam faced heavy criticism for his sluggish 90-ball 64 in Pakistan's 60-run loss to New Zealand.

title: Fort Knox gold reserves: How much is stored and how secure it is
content: Elon Musk will inspect the gold reserves at Fort Knox to ensure the gold is still there. Fort Knox, the US Bullion Depository since 1937, holds 147.3 million ounces of gold. Musk suggests a live tour to verify the reserves, highlighting public interest in the nation's gold.

title: Hindustani Bhau demands an apology from Farah Khan for the 'chhapri' remark
content: Hindustani Bhau, a social media celebrity, has demanded a public apology from choreographer-director Farah Khan. Bhau emphasized that her comments insulted Sanatan Dharma and depicted Hindu practices as negative. He also mentioned filing a police complaint to initiate legal action against her.

title: Will Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli rise to the occasion?
content: Rohit Sharma & Virat Kohli are in the autumn of their careers but they have stellar records against Pakistan in ODIs & ICC events. The duo aims to make a significant impact and achieve greatness once more in white-ball cricket. Can they rise to the occasion one more time?

title: Watch: Rescue op underway for 8 trapped in Telangana’s tunnel collapse
content: A portion of the Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) tunnel collapsed in Telangana's Nagarkurnool district on Saturday. At the time, 60 workers were on-site, and while 52 managed to escape, some with injuries, eight remain trapped. The exact location of the workers remains unknown until the debris is cleared.

title: 'Getting ready to do it': Trump renews push for reciprocal tariffs on India, China
content: US President Donald Trump has announced plans to impose reciprocal tariffs on India and China. The move follows discussions with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Trump said the move would ensure a level playing field for both countries. He said: “We’ll soon impose reciprocalTariffs because that means, they charge us, we charge them”

title: Guru Randhawa gets injured while performing stunt on the sets: 'Bahut mushkil kaam...'
content: Punjabi singer-actor Guru Randhawa injured himself while performing his first stunt during the shoot of 'Shaunki Sardar' He shared a picture from the hospital, assuring fans his spirit remains unbroken. Many fans and industry friends shared their well-wishes and encouragement.

title: 'When Trump, Modi talk they're called threat to democracy': Meloni slams 'Left'
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni criticizes the Left's reaction to Donald Trump's victory. She defends Trump and JD Vance, highlighting the conservative movement's collaboration and challenging liberal elites. Despite left-wing opposition, Meloni affirms her commitment to conservative principles.

title: 'Is '$21m' from US part of BJP's trillion-dollar narrative?': Akhilesh Yadav
content: Akhilesh Yadav questions the BJP government's $5 trillion economy claim while hinting at foreign influence in India's governance. Simultaneously, Donald Trump alleges USAID funding to India to boost voter turnout, raising concerns from India's Ministry of External Affairs and criticism from Congress.

title: How a 10x10 store in Gurgaon was the ‘hub’ of a Rs 67cr GST fraud
content: GST fraud network operating from a small shop in Khandsa village. Scheme generated fake invoices worth Rs 97 crore for tobacco products and soft drinks. Masterminded by Ashim Kumar, former property dealer, the scheme fraudulently claimed Rs 66.6 crore. Kumar has been arrested, and investigations are expanding.

title: Social media sparks meme fest after Pandya’s send-off to Babar Azam
content: Hardik Pandya dismissed Babar Azam during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 with a fiery delivery. The dismissal came at a crucial moment, with Babar's wicket falling at 41 in the ninth over. India entered the match as the favourites.

title: No mention of USAID funding for 'voter turnout' in finance ministry report
content: The finance ministry's annual report revealed that USAID funded seven projects worth USD 750 million in 2023-24, focusing on agriculture, water, renewable energy, and health. The report did not have any mention of the funds allegedly pumped in to "enhance voter turnout" ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls.
